We are considering the impact of applying another linear operator transformation defined by \\( F(x) = Mx \\) at time t=0, where \\( M \\) is also a linear operator.

Given only the end state \\( x(T) \\), can we accurately determine the transformations (\\( F(x) \\) or \\( G(x) \\), or both) applied to the system, merely from knowing \\( x(T) \\)?

Multiple different transformation paths can yield the same \\( x(T) \\) owing to the superposition and compositional variability of linear transformations.
